Also because of https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1850639/comments/4'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2019-10-31 11:38:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Folks, please point to the exact place in code where this field is used from FloatingIP DB object.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-10-31 13:29:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Folks, please point to the exact place in code where this field is
 > used from FloatingIP DB object.

https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/c21d922abd1208a72fe64d404a8eab93e0c56870/neutron/db/dns_db.py#L70-L76'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2019-10-31 13:47:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yeah, I was checking that one: so in fact this _extend_floatingip_dict_dns func is used here - https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/c21d922abd1208a72fe64d404a8eab93e0c56870/neutron/db/l3_db.py#L1121 - where it is actually db_obj which is passed to the func, not the OVO itself. db_obj is in fact "a database model that persists object data" (https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/c21d922abd1208a72fe64d404a8eab93e0c56870/neutron/objects/base.py#L427-L429) - so it should have 'dns' field because of orm relationship. So in fact 'dns' field of OVO FloatingIP is not used. Please correct me if I'm wrong.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2019-10-31 13:49:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry for a mess with DB object vs OVO object, here "Folks, please point to the exact place in code where this field is used from FloatingIP DB object" I actually meant "from FloatingIP OVO object"'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2019-10-31 14:08:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-10-31 14:16:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Sorry for a mess with DB object vs OVO object, here "Folks, please
 > point to the exact place in code where this field is used from
 > FloatingIP DB object" I actually meant "from FloatingIP OVO object"

In this case is almost the same. The OVO field "dns" is just a field of the declarative object and a direct translation from the DB view, in this case another DB register (FloatingIPDNS). Even if you remove "dns" from the OVO, the register FloatingIPDNS will be still retrieved every time you read a FloatingIP model (a DB view).'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2019-10-31 14:38:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yes, but performance is fixed by just removing dns from OVO, will it be removed from FloatingIP.db_obj as well you mean?'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-10-31 16:05:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/692280/2 : SUCCESS in 1h 56m 32s'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-10-31 17:18:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Yes, but performance is fixed by just removing dns from OVO, will
 > it be removed from FloatingIP.db_obj as well you mean?

What I mean is that you need first to find where the bottleneck is: in the Neutron server or in the Client-SDK.

You can query the DB directly, through the Neutron server, by using curl:

$ OS_TOKEN=`openstack token issue | grep "| id" | tr -s " " | cut -f4 -d" "`
$ curl -H "X-Auth-Token:$OS_TOKEN" "http://127.0.0.1:9696/v2.0/floatingips.json"  | python -m json.tool

If querying directly to the Neutron server is slow (and similar in time to the OSclient), then something is wrong with the DB/OVO modeling.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2019-10-31 18:37:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ah, yes, I am testing with curl, no client used. The log messages mentioned in bug disappear after removing the field from OVO.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2019-11-01 06:26:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-11-01 08:08:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/692280/2 : SUCCESS in 1h 40m 36s'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2019-11-01 11:35:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-11-01 12:45:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sorry but I don't have those results. I have only 100 FIPs, but I've tested with and without the "dns" field a the result is the same: more or less 0.18 secs

DEBUG neutron.wsgi [-] (27636) accepted ('192.168.10.20', 36876) {{(pid=27636) server /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/eventlet/wsgi.py:985}}
INFO neutron.wsgi [None req-8a147010-458f-4c33-bd33-ca61133cff1c demo admin] 192.168.10.20 "GET /v2.0/floatingips HTTP/1.1" status: 200  len: 25468 time: 0.1806517

When I use the client, the time goes up to 1.24 seconds, but the server call takes the same time (less than 0.2 seconds).

As commented before, this field is just calling NeutronDbObject.load_synthetic_db_fields(). Because this value is already loaded in the db object, the OVO class is just "loading" the object and setting the OVO attribute [1].

Are you sure that the OSclient is not introducing some kind of delay? BTW, I'm using master with PY3 and a newer sqlalchemy library than in Queens. Maybe this is why my results are different. I'll try now with 2000 FIPs.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/cc3886fd784a91cb42f0add60efb8da9f96328d8/neutron/objects/base.py#L857'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2019-11-01 13:03:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I don't use client when testing, just curl. sqlalchemy version on the test environment is 1.0.13, which version do you have? Can you please enable debug logs for sqlalchemy and see if log messages described in the bug appear in your log?"}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-11-01 13:14:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/692280/2 : SUCCESS in 1h 39m 01s'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-11-01 13:44:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I don't use client when testing, just curl. sqlalchemy version on
 > the test environment is 1.0.13, which version do you have? Can you
 > please enable debug logs for sqlalchemy and see if log messages
 > described in the bug appear in your log?

How did you enable the slqalchemy logs?"}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2019-11-01 13:55:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

On my env log_config_append is set and here's part of my log config http://paste.openstack.org/show/785709/
If log_config_append is not used then just need to set DEBUG for sqlalchemy in default_log_levels in neutron.conf I believe"}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2019-11-01 14:48:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-11-01 15:50:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Those are the results (1000 FIPs):
- with dns field: http://paste.openstack.org/show/785723/
- without: http://paste.openstack.org/show/785722/

No differences. The floatingipdns records are being retrieved in both cases because the DB object and it's relationships don't change. We retrieve in both cases the DNS records and then the OVO copies (in the first case) the value.

There is no gain removing the dns field.

BTW, in my system (a laptop), takes less than 1 sec to retrieve 1000 FIPs, using master, py3 and mysql."}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-11-01 16:41:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/692280/2 : SUCCESS in 1h 52m 14s'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2019-11-04 13:53:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Rodolfo, can you please check the version of sqlalchemy on you environment?'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-11-04 14:25:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> @Rodolfo, can you please check the version of sqlalchemy on you
 > environment?

1.3.10'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2019-11-13 11:11:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

The issue was fixed with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/565358/'}]

commit_message:
Remove 'dns' field from FloatingIP OVO

Not used currently and causes significant performance degradation
when listing floating IPs on loaded environments.

Change-Id: I235c5562b7233c3c5e2b1f348c8ebb5f4c371f44
Closes-Bug: #1850639

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

subject: Mask encryption_key_id
messages:
[{'account_id': 25837, 'date': '2019-02-02 08:46:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-02-13 11:35:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27838, 'date': '2019-02-14 17:24:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-02-18 06:04:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If encryption_key_id is an ID and not a key (in the bug report it appears to be a UUID) then it's not clear to me why it needs to be masked?"}, {'account_id': 25837, 'date': '2019-02-26 03:00:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> If encryption_key_id is an ID and not a key (in the bug report it
 > appears to be a UUID) then it's not clear to me why it needs to be
 > masked?

Anyone who get this encryption_key_id, can use GET method of key_manager service to get the encryption key easily."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-02-28 15:23:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > If encryption_key_id is an ID and not a key (in the bug report it
 > > appears to be a UUID) then it's not clear to me why it needs to
 > be
 > > masked?
 > 
 > Anyone who get this encryption_key_id, can use GET method of
 > key_manager service to get the encryption key easily.

Does the key manager service not require authentication?

I guess I'm fine with this anyway on the basis of defense in depth, but it seems concerning that it would be so easy to compromise an encryption key."}, {'account_id': 25837, 'date': '2019-03-27 01:59:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > > If encryption_key_id is an ID and not a key (in the bug report
 > it
 > > > appears to be a UUID) then it's not clear to me why it needs to
 > > be
 > > > masked?
 > >
 > > Anyone who get this encryption_key_id, can use GET method of
 > > key_manager service to get the encryption key easily.
 > 
 > Does the key manager service not require authentication?
 > 
 > I guess I'm fine with this anyway on the basis of defense in depth,
 > but it seems concerning that it would be so easy to compromise an
 > encryption key.

I'm afraid so.
It's too simple for somebody who knows how to implement it."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-03-27 14:11:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Okay, let's go with this then. Sounds like there is more room for improvement on the security of this stuff, but in the meantime this should mitigate it."}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2019-11-13 10:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit 3bd98032a2b7b6cc4a70d720e57dbd05265bc336'}]

subject: Update charter to skip the vice chair selection
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 1004, 'name': 'Mohammed Naser', 'email': 'mnaser@vexxhost.com', 'username': 'mnaser'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 8099, 'name': 'Graham Hayes', 'email': 'gr@ham.ie', 'username': 'graham'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 10607, 'name': 'Alexandra Settle', 'email': 'a.settle@outlook.com', 'username': 'asettle'}, {'_account_id': 12404, 'name': 'Rico Lin', 'email': 'ricolin@ricolky.com', 'username': 'rico.lin'}, {'_account_id': 13995, 'name': 'Nate Johnston', 'email': 'nate.johnston@redhat.com', 'username': 'natejohnston'}, {'_account_id': 16708, 'name': 'Kendall Nelson', 'display_name': 'Kendall (diablo_rojo)', 'email': 'kennelson11@gmail.com', 'username': 'kjnelson'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-21 17:22:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-09-21 21:52:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think the most important reason a vice-chair was added was to act as a backup point of contact when the chair is unavailable. You could of course come up with another name for that fallback contact, but "vice-chair" seems like the most appropriate term for them.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-09-21 21:54:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For reference, the vice-chair delegation was originally added in the I3e520eb0d900bc3d0552afbb5bcb9fd13fd0d09c change, so some of the history of that change could provide additional insight.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-22 01:29:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Tasks can be delegated by Chair on a dynamic basis and need to any TC member which I think does not need to assign any particular name. In absence Chair, it can be a dedicated TC member and published the contact person to ML and BoD. it can be called as running or temporary chair (same as PTL does in their absence.)'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2019-09-22 17:17:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1 Code-Review+1

This makes sense to me.  Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-09-22 18:23:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ghanshyam Mann wrote:

> Tasks can be delegated by Chair on a dynamic basis and need to any
> TC member which I think does not need to assign any particular name.
> In absence Chair, it can be a dedicated TC member and published the
> contact person to ML and BoD. it can be called as running or
> temporary chair (same as PTL does in their absence.)

That does seem like it would make it harder for, say, board members to figure out who to contact when the chair is unavailable. Regardless, the vice-chair is already an informal delegation, it just happens to have a name for clarity and ease of discovery.

Also, just as a reminder, there is at least one volunteer for TC vice-chair this term: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-tc/%23openstack-tc.2019-09-20.log.html#t2019-09-20T17:30:22'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-09-23 07:47:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think the vice-chair has two benefits:

1- it adds predictability -- in absence of the chair we always have a clear fallback

2- it's an opportunity to train someone new to the TC house rules, someone that would be a natural candidate to take the helm in a future session

Due to (2) I'd prefer if one of our newcomers would take it, but if not I might volunteer to preserve (1)."}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-09-23 10:14:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I think gmann's point is that if we don't have someone willing to step up, it's not a necessity and we can move on without getting bogged down in this step.

Whilst I personally think the vice chair is a good thing to retain for exactly the reasons described by fungi and ttx, it is always good to include an "out". code review +1 only until discussion is over.'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-09-23 10:18:05.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-23 11:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yeah, I am not saying we do not need vice-chair. If there is no candidate for that in any cycle then we can skip and not make this as hard requirement for TC working.

An alternate dedicated person is always good but if we make it a mandatory in TC leadership then it is something I feel extra mandatory requirement. If there are volunteer it will go in same way and complete the both purpose ttx mentioned. But if we do not have anyone to be volunteer then we should not have someone force to do.'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2019-09-23 11:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

I think we are trying to anticipate something that is unlikely. If the situation comes about where the chair is having issues appointing the vice-chair, we can update it then.'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-09-23 11:41:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-09-24 08:55:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah I'm not sure we need to anticipate all cases. Could go either way"}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-09-27 14:16:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

TC vice chair is a necessity, it helps build the necessary information needed for continuity of the knowledge necessary to run the TC.

It also makes it a very straightforward point of contact to the TC.'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-09-27 15:25:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

I feel similar to mnaser on this one.'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-09-27 15:25:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1 -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-10-01 12:05:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

We can cross that bridge when we'll get there :)"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-10-04 15:04:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

It appears there are plenty of volunteers for now, so I don't think we need to make a decision on this. I'm not convinced that dynamic assignment is a solution as it still needs a volunteer (unless we are talking dynamic involuntary assignment :)"}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-10-10 13:32:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2019-10-10 22:00:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

I think it would be a good idea to have a backup plan for when there isn't a volunteer, but I don't think just accepting there isnt a volunteer is the best solution. I think vice chairs are super important so that there is a single point of contact when the chair is out."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-10-14 12:08:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

I don't think it helps. Would rather cross that bridge IF we get to it."}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-10-16 09:15:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

As an alternative solution, we should raise requests for looking for vice-chair again, and again until we can find one to volunteer (better late than never). I'm fine if the seat stay empty."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-10-16 13:23:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Has that happened yet? So far, at least as much as I can remember, each time the chair has made a formal request for vice chair volunteers there has been as least one to step forward more or less immediately (within a day).'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-11-07 11:06:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The majority of TC members appear to disagree with this motion based on the voting below.
I recommend that this is tabled for now, and if we need to revisit this in future, we can resurrect this conversation. But we have a vice-chair, Rico, and no debate on that assignment.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-11-13 10:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I am abandoning this, as there seems to have a consensus on not doing it. Anyone can revive if necessary.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-21 17:22:26.000000000', 'message': 'Update charter to skip the vice chair selection

TC vice chair is an internal assignment of TC to organize and
help the TC chair responsibilities. In any cycle, if TC chair does not find
volunteer for vice chair, it is ok to skip the vice chair selection and
assign the tasks dynamically to any TC member.

Change-Id: Idd0880357efa6acdd1e3916625a6a11dcc4a8767
'}]
commit_message:
Update charter to skip the vice chair selection

TC vice chair is an internal assignment of TC to organize and
help the TC chair responsibilities. In any cycle, if TC chair does not find
volunteer for vice chair, it is ok to skip the vice chair selection and
assign the tasks dynamically to any TC member.

Change-Id: Idd0880357efa6acdd1e3916625a6a11dcc4a8767

commit_message:
Drop Mistral support for the Validations CLI

This patch removes the possibility to run the validations through the
CLI with Mistral. Ansible is now the only way to run the validations.

Change-Id: I8bd9f4c4512279a291963d0b6df62316e7410f2b
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c6616f8d96013bd5f5ccfec54e3eb2b37fd7884b)

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-05-17 09:23:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-05-17 09:23:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-05-17 12:35:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

We don't have support for 'domain_search' in ovs for ipv4:
http://www.openvswitch.org/support/dist-docs/ovn-nb.5.html

thats why the 'dns_domain' parameter from neutron network object is not passed to DHCP and at the end to the instance. Thats why neutron_tempest_plugin.scenario.test_internal_dns.InternalDNSTest test fails.

We should add support for it into ovn core and then to networking-ovn."}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-05-21 12:21:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

It's enough to use domain_name option:

https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/1102717/

Since we have one domain per neutron network its enough to use 'domain_name' parameter instead 'domain_search'. In related patch that will be on the bottom of this patch I'll propose use of 'domain_name'."}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-05-21 15:12:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Patch Set 12 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-05-21 15:13:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

rebased to be on top of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/660423/'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-05-22 09:22:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Patch Set 13 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-05-28 08:11:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-05-28 08:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Patch Set 15 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-05-28 08:17:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-19 09:11:39.000000000', 'message': 'Enable tempest DNS tests

This patch is enabling the tempest DNS tests in our gate which was
previously being skipped.

The "dns-integration" integration is being enabled as a supported
extension and the code to configure DNS was added to the devstack
plugin.

The following tests are now expect to run in gate:

neutron_tempest_plugin.api.test_networks.NetworksTestJSON.test_create_update_network_dns_domain
neutron_tempest_plugin.api.test_ports.PortsTestJSON.test_create_update_port_with_dns_name
neutron_tempest_plugin.api.test_ports.PortsTestJSON.test_create_update_port_with_no_dns_name

Change-Id: I828d04dca62dfd913460048694d49fdba3956001

commit_message:
Enable tempest DNS tests

This patch is enabling the tempest DNS tests in our gate which was
previously being skipped.

The "dns-integration" integration is being enabled as a supported
extension and q-dns has been enabled by default in gate.

The following tests are now expect to run in gate:

neutron_tempest_plugin.api.test_networks.NetworksTestJSON.test_create_update_network_dns_domain
neutron_tempest_plugin.api.test_ports.PortsTestJSON.test_create_update_port_with_dns_name
neutron_tempest_plugin.api.test_ports.PortsTestJSON.test_create_update_port_with_no_dns_name

After OVS 2.12 release with merged patch [1] this test should be enabled:
neutron_tempest_plugin.scenario.test_internal_dns.InternalDNSTest.test_dns_name

[1] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/1102717/

Co-Authored-By: Maciej Józefczyk <mjozefcz@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I828d04dca62dfd913460048694d49fdba3956001

commit_message:
Make mask_password case insensitive, and add new patterns

It appears that Mistral service logs everything, and doesn't use yet
the mask_password (nor mask_dict_password) method. In order to ensure
all is properly masked, we have to add some new patterns, and make it
case insensitive in order to simplify and avoid duplicated entries.

Change-Id: Icc19b7c8bdb6a3182939d5e9fdef21288b19f43d
Related-Bug: #1850843
Signed-off-by: Cédric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make mask_password case insensitive, and add new patterns

It appears that Mistral service logs everything, and doesn't use yet
the mask_password (nor mask_dict_password) method. In order to ensure
all is properly masked, we have to add some new patterns, and make it
case insensitive in order to simplify and avoid duplicated entries.

Change-Id: Icc19b7c8bdb6a3182939d5e9fdef21288b19f43d
Related-Bug: #1850843
Signed-off-by: Cédric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit b41268417cecb12d1d5955ee3107067edf050221)

commit_message:
Add spec for VM-scoped SR-IOV NUMA affinity

This spec adds two new image/flavor properties
to allow spcifying a NUMA affinity policy for
PCI devices including neutron SR-IOV interfaces.

blueprint: vm-scoped-sriov-numa-affinity
Change-Id: I66b556025ee2f704b91be1249d793e2eeaa1d891

commit_message:
Use more exact path to Zuul source dir

Be more specific when specifying path to source of the project,
so that we can run these jobs on different projects and
dependencies.
Add these paths to some of molecule jobs to test.
Change-Id: I09f7b29eb37d5c728d97dd4f27b4465fa0fb26f2

commit_message:
Idempotency for podman_container

Introduce partial idepmpotency for running podman_container

- Replace all options by their defaults it they're not set
- Force lower case on all podman inspection data
- Add a class with methods for every parameter to check its value
and compare it with module argument
- Add check_mode support and podman_actions

Change-Id: I1ae93dff1e10a1a696bb171996a75a0db6c34fa3

commit_message:
Use admin neutron client to gather port resource requests

The network_api get_requested_resource_for_instance() creates a neutron
client with the current request context and uses the client to query
neutron ports. Neutron does not return the resource_request of the
neutron port if it is queried by a non-admin. So if the request context
was a non admin context nova thought that none of the ports have resource
requests.

This patch ensures that an admin client is used to query the ports.

Change-Id: I1178fb77a74010c3b9f51eea22c7e7576b600015
Closes-Bug: #1849695

commit_message:
Use admin neutron client to query ports for binding

The compute service updates the binding:profile of the neutron port
during server create. If the port has resource_request then the
'allocation' key need to point to the resource provider the port is
allocating resources. Unfortunately this code used a non admin client to
query the port data and therefore if the original server create request
was sent by a non admin user the returned port does not have its
resource_request filled and as a consequence nova does not add the
allocation key to the binding profile.

This patch makes sure that the port is queried with an admin client.

There is a tempest test change that reproduces the issue:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/690934

Change-Id: Icc631cf2e81a5c78cb7fb1d0b625d19bd8f5a274
Closes-Bug: #1849657

commit_message:
Ensure LB SG is not updated for egress only policy

When an egress Network Policy is enforced, there is no
need to allow the update of the LB SG. Right now, as this
operation is being allowed, we can end up with ingress
rules being removed from the LB.

Closes-Bug: 1850715
Change-Id: Idcdef5c4f2f47a165bfb9b38779b591d5b995216

commit_message:
Ensure Network Policy handles egress traffic to a SVC

We're not taking into account the case of a Network Policy
with an egress rule to a pod that contains a Service sitting
in front of it. Right now, only an egress rule to the matched
pod is created, when one for the matched SVC is also required.

Related-Bug: 1849139
Change-Id: I9830f30ba1fde3e5ec1a98fcbca22af992dd1bec

commit_message:
Add missing unittests to OVN provider driver

This change bumps up test coverage.
During writing those tests I found also a few issues:

1) In method pool_update the operating_status shouldn't
be set with veryfing if the pool has members or not.
The only way of setting operating_status to OFFLINE is
to administratively disable it or via member healt monitor,
which we don't yet support. Dropping this wrong code.
https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/load-balancer/v2/?expanded=create-pool-detail#create-pool

2) _check_monitor_options() logic was wrong - fixed it

3) In pool_delete() in some coditions the external_ids
could be used, but not initlized. I moved it to be on the top
of function.

Change-Id: Ib60ba2b7a958e3d55699988d9d4f2b848e5e1b5a

> (1 comment)


I see some inconsistency here. DHCP agent in ml2/ovs starts dnsmasq with domain_name always [0] (without skipping if 'openstacklocal' is set).
From the other hand, while setting port dns options I see that in this case the domain name is skipped [1].

I would stay with how it is done in neutron dhcp agent, because I'm touching the same functionality here.

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-10-03 09:23:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

So we need RDO promotion on:
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/22603/

Then we need to have fresh OVS/OVN 2.12 version in https://hub.docker.com/u/tripleomaster/

And then we would be able to bump this one.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-10-03 09:35:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1 Workflow-1

wait wait :)
We don't want to merge this and block RDO promotions. Can't we include some checks to make it compatible with < 2.12?"}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-10-07 07:03:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

> wait wait :)
 > We don't want to merge this and block RDO promotions. Can't we
 > include some checks to make it compatible with < 2.12?

That's tricky. In code we can try to verify if given table exist in schema, but not if a given key in options is accepted or not. NBDB accepts domain_name key but ovn-controller fails on parsing it.

We have a few solutions:
1) Ask community to cherry-pick related patch to OVS 2.11, then wait for RDO to consume it.
2) Prepare a check in NBDB schema, to not accept values for dhcp_options which are not valid one. This will end with an exception that we could handle. Then cherry-pick it down to OVS 2.11.
3) Try to play with a version schema. Perhaps we can get it somehow from the DB. Then validate if it needs our minimum version."}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-10-23 07:27:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Tempest, that is runned under tripleo networking-ovn-tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode gate doesn't use any DNS functionality.

For me we can change the domain_name to default one, in order to not pass it to OVN (the mechanism works only if default is not set).

Then we'll have this gate passing and we could merge this u/s.
While OVS 2.12 will be promoted in RDO we can drop this constraint from jobs configuration."}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-10-31 10:23:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-10-31 10:29:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I modified it to not set dns_domain name if the default variable is set, similar to how we enable internally dns name resolution.

The TripleO gate don't run dns-related tests, so I believe the option is unchanged there, and it will pass now."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-11-01 13:48:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-11-01 16:56:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

\o/ networking-ovn-tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode

So, wanna merge this one :)?'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-11-01 18:56:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-11-07 08:24:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-11-08 05:45:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-11-09 03:18:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Change passed domain_name parameter value

Previously [0] passed parameter was taken from the port domain.
In fact it is wrong, based on what is done in ml2/ovs it should be
taken from neutron configuration [1].

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/660423
[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/b0a93df47637958fc3fc172f15e8593d6e9b181a/neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py#L427

Change-Id: I13f9213c558fc95d97052fb8b98246f1ef555120

Everything is fine but looks like the 'openstackgate.local' is hardcoded in the test:
testtools.matchers._impl.MismatchError: 'openstackgate.local' not in 'search ovngate.local\nnameserver 127.0.0.1\n'

So we need to change our gate configuration from 'ovngate.local' to 'openstackgate.local' in order to run this test."}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-09-27 06:13:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-09-27 06:27:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-09-27 11:32:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Enable InternalDNS related tests

Previously this test needed OVN 2.12 release.
As it is shipped lets enable the test.

The test test_internal_dns.InternalDNSTest is configured
to use hardcoded domain_name value [0]. So in order
to have it passing we need to change our gates configuration
accordingly.

In addition we need to configure parameter ovn.dns_servers for
gate, because otherwise dns_server: 127.0.0.53 will be passed
for VM while using Ubuntu 18.04 on gates [1].

OPTION:  60 ( 12) Vendor class identifier   udhcp 1.23.2
---------------------------------------------------------------------------

  TIME: 2019-09-30 10:14:12.519

  SECS: 0

GIADDR: 0.0.0.0

 SNAME: .
 FNAME: .

commit_message:
Stop requiring root size for whole disk images

This requirement has been fixed in newer versions of ironic.

Change-Id: I4460755ee66b4aa0b8a651b6bd142c769d669ee2

subject: Update check-requirements for py3
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-11-09 20:57:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-11-10 17:52:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28543, 'date': '2019-11-11 15:47:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-11-12 00:55:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I'm really on the fence with this.  It totally fixes a bug but that code is just wrong and we have a much better way to handle things now.

We can just make the script actually require openstack_requirements and treat it like any other library rather than doing this magic dance."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-11-12 12:05:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'm really on the fence with this.  It totally fixes a bug but that
 > code is just wrong and we have a much better way to handle things
 > now.
 > 
 > We can just make the script actually require openstack_requirements
 > and treat it like any other library rather than doing this magic
 > dance.

This is a zuul playbook, so I think we can add a command for easily running this locally, but we will still need some of this for making sure the job runs correctly."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-11-13 04:26:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> > I'm really on the fence with this.  It totally fixes a bug but
 > that
 > > code is just wrong and we have a much better way to handle things
 > > now.
 > >
 > > We can just make the script actually require openstack_requirements
 > > and treat it like any other library rather than doing this magic
 > > dance.
 > 
 > This is a zuul playbook, so I think we can add a command for easily
 > running this locally, but we will still need some of this for
 > making sure the job runs correctly.

https://review.opendev.org/693967 is more or less what I'm thinking.

I'll test it in the gate later this week"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-09 20:57:56.000000000', 'message': 'Update check-requirements for py3

This updates the virtual environment handling to assume it is running
with Python 3.7 instead of 2.7. It also updates the virtualenv detection
to recognize if it is running python from a virtualenv without the
virtualenv actually being activated.

Change-Id: Ib841f1d6a683eff4836bfeeb73678199745a3a2f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update check-requirements for py3

This updates the virtual environment handling to assume it is running
with Python 3.7 instead of 2.7. It also updates the virtualenv detection
to recognize if it is running python from a virtualenv without the
virtualenv actually being activated.

Change-Id: Ib841f1d6a683eff4836bfeeb73678199745a3a2f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Do not use unsupported field filter in testing
messages:
[{'account_id': 26106, 'date': '2019-11-06 15:56:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26106, 'date': '2019-11-06 15:57:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-11-06 16:02:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Can you add a storyboard story that describes the problem?

This test passes and we have code that supports field filtering when listing capabilities:
https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/octavia/api/v2/controllers/provider.py#L96

So I'm not sure I understand the problem that led to this change."}, {'account_id': 26106, 'date': '2019-11-06 16:11:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Michael,
To answer your question quickly:
There are two kind of filters in play here:
fields=name&name=test; so one for fields to be returned and one for actual results being returned.
You are actually ignoring the second kind of filter.

I will make a storyboard story :)'}, {'account_id': 26106, 'date': '2019-11-06 16:34:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-11-06 16:38:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-11-06 16:39:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thank you, that helps us understand the problem.
I updated the commit message to use the "Story: " tag that StoryBoard uses.'}, {'account_id': 26106, 'date': '2019-11-06 17:14:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

thx!'}, {'account_id': 26106, 'date': '2019-11-07 10:11:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-11-12 18:11:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I have fixed the bug in the provider capabilities API that caused filtering to not function.
Is there another concern with this test for other providers we should address in this change to the test?'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-11-12 18:11:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Fix: https://review.opendev.org/693760'}, {'account_id': 26106, 'date': '2019-11-13 07:56:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Thanks Michael,

Seems fine to me with the fix, I will abandon this patchset.'}, {'account_id': 26106, 'date': '2019-11-13 07:57:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Actual fix in the pipeline'}]

commit_message:
Do not use unsupported field filter in testing

Flavor capabilities does not support
filters (eg. name=test).
Remove relying on this filter and allow the test
to pass in more diverse environments.

Story: 2006817
Task: 37377
Change-Id: I34851555b04c2b9de41e635a682435db87b1a2a9

commit_message:
Handle relative paths for local check-requirements

Existing handling was looking for the local path by moving up the
directory chain. With a relative path this would result in an empty
string for the requirements directory, then fail to find fail to find
files in the system root.

Change-Id: I0b77859eea4d2841ba148623b5bca7d1d165c89b
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Use master branch for ipa builder

ipa builder repo has no stable branches

Needs backporting to Train to fix the issue.
It does not affect master because it matches the branch.

This did not affect CI because it provided its own repos.

Change-Id: Ib2ced2c9970d45c8b9a2fa6be036f26f9b792e6b
Story: 2006836
Task: 37411

commit_message:
Fix install-deps.sh failing on bare CentOS 7 due to old pip

This change upgrades pip instead of just ensuring it meets
the lowest version constraint.

This is in line with the setuptools being upgraded just below.

This did not affect CI because it provided its own pip.

Change-Id: I36a0e31ecba1dc9d5eec1d2338dc752467be5ac0
Story: 2006833
Task: 37406

commit_message:
Reload systemd when configuring SSL for Newton.

At Newton when the certificates relation is joined the ceilometer-api
systemd override file is written with an updated port but systemd is
not reloaded. This causes ceilometer-api to bind to the wrong port
which fails since it is already in use.

Change-Id: I56579368173c6a269fcbad897649f92001cf539e
Closes-Bug: #1852050

commit_message:
Cleanup the sriov_numvfs config scripts

Clean
    1) /etc/udev/rules.d/70-tripleo-reset-sriov.rules
    2) /sbin/ifup-local
    3) /etc/sysconfig/allocate_vfs
Create /etc/udev/rules.d/70-os-net-config-sriov.rules for legacy PFs

Change-Id: I17c8ef03501de75f0e3f7fb6c06be3478b1b5863
(cherry picked from commit fb296079eba18b232959ca8e1bc109f3ca091b4f)

commit_message:
Unretire api-site

The api-site hosts *only* the index page for
https://developer.openstack.org, all other content in it has been
deleted or moved.

We need to maintain the repo for the following reasons:
* Host the index page in an OpenStack owned repo
* Host the redirects for all the API documentation. The docs itself
  were moved this year to docs.openstack.org but lots of older
  (Stein and earlier releases) documentation and code have links
  to developer.openstack.org, so those redirects are important.

Un-retire the repository and add it to the Documentation team, the team
can maintain it even if it becomes a SIG.

Change-Id: Id564c949b003f0f498151dc91846ab2d0a2001ee

commit_message:
Drop legacy log folder and readme

We switched to containers a long time ago. This patch drops the
management of a /var/log/<service> directory and the creation of a
readme indicating that we've moved to containers which makes the logging
available under /var/log/containers/<service>

Change-Id: Ia4e991d5d937031ac3312f639b726a944743dd1e

commit_message:
Clean up instance defaults setting

This change fixes a problem where an instance entry was not being
populated with an image specified in the defaults dict. This change
sets up a baseline defaults dict before validating the roles, and
populates any instances with the defaults in-place.

Change-Id: I1929e1b135ed539a6da09b1ec5d2b64b6281dc47
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy
Closes-Bug: 1851575

poking around.

Change-Id: I99a6beda9c3a8883d9f13a953cba13aa21d847bb
'}]
commit_message:
py3: Fix up some func tests

Lots of str-needing-to-be-bytes fixes, mostly.

Seems to be an issue with tests around executing? Skipped the two that
would just hang, but test_deploy_storlet might be a good place to start
poking around.

Change-Id: I99a6beda9c3a8883d9f13a953cba13aa21d847bb

subject: Remove requirements-integration job
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-12 17:03:02.000000000', 'message': 'Remove requirements-integration job

This job was a legacy job that attempted to verify each project could be
independently installed after all global-requirements had been
installed.

This job is no longer necessary since we have much better coverage with
requirements-check and other jobs that make sure the requirements are
compatible. It is also a legacy zuulv2 job, uses the long deprecated
devstack-gate, and runs with Python 2.7.

For historical reference, this was added originally to PBR back in 2013
[0] and moved to requirements in 2014 [1].

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/pbr/commit/378261a8cba818a29b7e3d33b917de5ed0751579
[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/8e073738db06086f949d2be377999356aee2d8d0

Change-Id: I29abcba929995f9307c392110160d889a29b47c3
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove requirements-integration job

This job was a legacy job that attempted to verify each project could be
independently installed after all global-requirements had been
installed.

This job is no longer necessary since we have much better coverage with
requirements-check and other jobs that make sure the requirements are
compatible. It is also a legacy zuulv2 job, uses the long deprecated
devstack-gate, and runs with Python 2.7.

For historical reference, this was added originally to PBR back in 2013
[0] and moved to requirements in 2014 [1].

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/pbr/commit/378261a8cba818a29b7e3d33b917de5ed0751579
[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/8e073738db06086f949d2be377999356aee2d8d0

Change-Id: I29abcba929995f9307c392110160d889a29b47c3
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

As of version 4, ceph-ansible ships it's own filter_plugins [1]

executes ceph-ansible.

This change is going directly into Stein becauase the relevant
code was moved from tripleo-heat-templates to tripleo-ansible

and Train (64f6d3ba1979e21fdf5392a056c13f313220be3e) in tripleo-

Closes-Bug: #1852136

commit_message:
Include ceph-ansible filter_plugins

As of version 4, ceph-ansible ships it's own filter_plugins [1]
so we need to include them in the environment when tripleo
executes ceph-ansible.

This change is going directly into Stein becauase the relevant
code was moved from tripleo-heat-templates to tripleo-ansible
during Train. The same change has already been proposed in Master
and Train (64f6d3ba1979e21fdf5392a056c13f313220be3e) in tripleo-
ansible.

Change-Id: I434273b4fee2719eb6ea9f4392364644446f11e6
Closes-Bug: #1852136

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-25 14:41:11.000000000', 'message': "tox: Keeping going with docs

Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Change-Id: I9acc4d59798a160222ef1fb49f591262e66911a2
"}]
commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Change-Id: I9acc4d59798a160222ef1fb49f591262e66911a2

value should be preferred over any other. This fixes an issue in the

commit_message:
Prefer ovn_dbs_vip from all_nodes_extra_map_data

When all_nodes_extra_map_data includes a value for ovn_dbs_vip that
value should be preferred over any other. This fixes an issue in the
multi-stack case where the dependent stacks were using the wrong value
for the ovn vip.

Change-Id: Idf534e50d3a1ec879c340996ac225c80f4b52d3f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-12 20:08:44.000000000', 'message': 'Remove opensuse-150

The opensuse-150 image is being removed as the 15.0 release is EOL.
Similar to centos the expectation is that users keep up to date with
minor releases. For this we have the opensuse-15 image which should be
used instead.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682844/
Change-Id: I8db99f8f2fd4b1b7b9a5e06148ca2dc185ed682b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove opensuse-150

The opensuse-150 image is being removed as the 15.0 release is EOL.
Similar to centos the expectation is that users keep up to date with
minor releases. For this we have the opensuse-15 image which should be
used instead.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682844/
Change-Id: I8db99f8f2fd4b1b7b9a5e06148ca2dc185ed682b

commit_message:
Include ceph-ansible filter_plugins

As of version 4, ceph-ansible ships it's own filter_plugins [1]
so we need to include them in the environment when tripleo
executes ceph-ansible.

Closes-Bug: #1852136

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/commit/5fea830414e7eb4cf6f1d0008834e2c4b205b131

Change-Id: Ia16edde342b0c86c31c5715a28dbfe370cfb3246
(cherry picked from commit 64f6d3ba1979e21fdf5392a056c13f313220be3e)

commit_message:
tripleo-container-manage: use async

- Add a new filter 'haskey' which returns container data with a specific
  config key. The filter takes a list of dicts and returns the dicts
  which have a certain key given in parameter with 'attribute'.
  If 'reverse' is set to True, the returned list won't contains dicts
  which have the 'attribute' value.
  If 'any' is set to True, the returned list will match any value in the
  list of 'value' parameter which has to be a list.

- Make the exec and create playbook using ansible "async".
  (WIP is to re-add the podman_container.changed in systemd playbook).

Note: we don't manage Systemd resources with async, since it exposes
race conditions at the systemd level.

Change-Id: Ice92cd5f90039e685c171e9035f929349a67ff2c

commit_message:
Add and switch to the newly created opensuse-15 nodeset

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use
it by default going forward.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/682882
Change-Id: Ic3f4d6998a66da5226bc95088d7e3c83dfe737ce
(cherry picked from commit 70fca49de75a77fd766d5b72f8757e4f7c0a7a48)

Change-Id: I4211cfbd23eeb7badd834c1108823b416a186265
Closes-Bug: #1634382

commit_message:
Put storage policy index in object-server responses

Not going to worry about 507s and the like, but 2xx, 404, etc. could
benefit from returning that info.

Co-Authored-By: Christian Hugo <hugo.christian@web.de>
Change-Id: I4211cfbd23eeb7badd834c1108823b416a186265
Closes-Bug: #1634382

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-07 22:42:06.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Plumb allow_cross_cell_resize into compute API resize()

Just like Mario and Luigi.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I098f91d8c498e5a85266e193ad37c08aca4792b2
'}, {'created': '2019-02-08 01:39:16.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Plumb allow_cross_cell_resize into compute API resize()

Just like Mario and Luigi.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I098f91d8c498e5a85266e193ad37c08aca4792b2
'}, {'created': '2019-02-08 21:19:46.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Plumb allow_cross_cell_resize into compute API resize()

Just like Mario and Luigi.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I098f91d8c498e5a85266e193ad37c08aca4792b2
'}, {'created': '2019-02-11 17:53:32.000000000', 'message': 'Plumb allow_cross_cell_resize into compute API resize()

This adds a stub method to the compute API which will
eventually perform a policy check and compute service
version check to determine if cross-cell resize is
allowed when performing a resize or cold migration. This
is always False for now but can be mocked for testing here
and in subsequent changes that add functional tests for
the cross-cell resize flow before the confirm/revert code
is ready.

For cold migration with a target host, validation logic
is split out into a separate method to add the cross-cell
validation of the target host since if cross-cell resize
is allowed, the target host could be in another cell from
where the instance currently exists.

Currently, the resize/migrate API actions are synchronous
until conductor RPC casts to prep_resize() on the selected
target compute service. This could be problematic during a
cross-cell resize since that flow is orchestrated from
(super)conductor and is synchronous, i.e. the compute services
do not RPC cast between each other like a traditional resize.
Until the 2.34 microversion, the live migrate API had the
same problem. If the request is allowed to perform a cross-cell
resize then we will RPC cast from API to conductor. The API
user still gets a 202 response either way.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I098f91d8c498e5a85266e193ad37c08aca4792b2

the cross-cell resize flow before the confirm/revert code
is ready.

For cold migration with a target host, validation logic
is split out into a separate method to add the cross-cell
validation of the target host since if cross-cell resize
is allowed, the target host could be in another cell from
where the instance currently exists.

Currently, the resize/migrate API actions are synchronous
until conductor RPC casts to prep_resize() on the selected
target compute service. This could be problematic during a
cross-cell resize since that flow is orchestrated from
(super)conductor and is synchronous, i.e. the compute services
do not RPC cast between each other like a traditional resize.
Until the 2.34 microversion, the live migrate API had the
same problem. If the request is allowed to perform a cross-cell
resize then we will RPC cast from API to conductor. The API
user still gets a 202 response either way.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I098f91d8c498e5a85266e193ad37c08aca4792b2

do not RPC cast between each other like a traditional resize.
Until the 2.34 microversion, the live migrate API had the
same problem. If the request is allowed to perform a cross-cell
resize then we will RPC cast from API to conductor. The API
user still gets a 202 response either way.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I098f91d8c498e5a85266e193ad37c08aca4792b2
'}, {'created': '2019-05-28 23:08:43.000000000', 'message': 'Plumb allow_cross_cell_resize into compute API resize()

This adds a stub method to the compute API which will
eventually perform a policy check and compute service
version check to determine if cross-cell resize is
allowed when performing a resize or cold migration. This
is always False for now but can be mocked for testing here
and in subsequent changes that add functional tests for
the cross-cell resize flow before the confirm/revert code
is ready.

For cold migration with a target host, validation logic
is split out into a separate method to add the cross-cell
validation of the target host since if cross-cell resize
is allowed, the target host could be in another cell from
where the instance currently exists.

Currently, the resize/migrate API actions are synchronous
until conductor RPC casts to prep_resize() on the selected
target compute service. This could be problematic during a
cross-cell resize since that flow is orchestrated from
(super)conductor and is synchronous, i.e. the compute services
do not RPC cast between each other like a traditional resize.
Until the 2.34 microversion, the live migrate API had the
same problem. If the request is allowed to perform a cross-cell
resize then we will RPC cast from API to conductor. The API
user still gets a 202 response either way.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

This adds a stub method to the compute API which will
eventually perform a policy check and compute service
version check to determine if cross-cell resize is
allowed when performing a resize or cold migration. This
is always False for now but can be mocked for testing here
and in subsequent changes that add functional tests for
the cross-cell resize flow before the confirm/revert code
is ready.

For cold migration with a target host, validation logic
is split out into a separate method to add the cross-cell
validation of the target host since if cross-cell resize
is allowed, the target host could be in another cell from
where the instance currently exists.

Currently, the resize/migrate API actions are synchronous
until conductor RPC casts to prep_resize() on the selected
target compute service. This could be problematic during a
cross-cell resize since that flow is orchestrated from
(super)conductor and is synchronous, i.e. the compute services
do not RPC cast between each other like a traditional resize.
Until the 2.34 microversion, the live migrate API had the
same problem. If the request is allowed to perform a cross-cell
resize then we will RPC cast from API to conductor. The API
user still gets a 202 response either way.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I098f91d8c498e5a85266e193ad37c08aca4792b2

commit_message:
Plumb allow_cross_cell_resize into compute API resize()

This adds a stub method to the compute API which will
eventually perform a policy check and compute service
version check to determine if cross-cell resize is
allowed when performing a resize or cold migration. This
is always False for now but can be mocked for testing here
and in subsequent changes that add functional tests for
the cross-cell resize flow before the confirm/revert code
is ready.

For cold migration with a target host, validation logic
is split out into a separate method to add the cross-cell
validation of the target host since if cross-cell resize
is allowed, the target host could be in another cell from
where the instance currently exists.

Currently, the resize/migrate API actions are synchronous
until conductor RPC casts to prep_resize() on the selected
target compute service. This could be problematic during a
cross-cell resize since that flow is orchestrated from
(super)conductor and is synchronous, i.e. the compute services
do not RPC cast between each other like a traditional resize.
Until the 2.34 microversion, the live migrate API had the
same problem. If the request is allowed to perform a cross-cell
resize then we will RPC cast from API to conductor. The API
user still gets a 202 response either way.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: I098f91d8c498e5a85266e193ad37c08aca4792b2

commit_message:
Clone os_tempest and it's dependencies in nodepool

While running quickstart.sh locally, these repos needs to clonned
by the nodepool so that while running tempest using os_tempest
it does not complains.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix Chart.yaml

The apiVersion in the ingress chart's Chart.yaml is strangely missing,
causing some version of the helm linter to fail. This patchset places
back the missing apiVersion into the Chart.yaml.

commit_message:
Switch to opensuse-15 nodeset

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use
it by default going forward.

The new job tempest-full-py3-opensuse15 use the opensuse-15 nodeset,
change tempest-full-py3-opensuse150 to tempest-full-py3-opensuse15.

Change-Id: Ia76b107a137a39716253631e5a8d294f7ee9614e
(cherry picked from commit e45d5e3b9259620914ff3e3c5fa67dd23de1879c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-10 00:00:39.000000000', 'message': "Drop project.id foreign keys

In 2bd88d30 we added a new column domain_id to the user table to
deduplicate the domain_id columns in the local_user and nonlocal_user
tables, and at that point made the user.domain_id column a foreign key
referencing the project.id column. This is a problem that led to
3d46c8a5 in which we removed the ability for the resource driver to be
pluggable, since we had linked two sql backends together and made them
reliant on one another.

This commit removes the foreign key constraint from the user table and
the identity_provider table. For the user table, the sqlalchemy model
never reflected this schema so we don't need to change the model. For
the identity_provider table, we need to update the model. In both cases,
we already enforce, at the manager layer, the constraint that the
domain_id needs to reference a real domain ID[1][2], so we do not need
to rely on this constraint at the database layer.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/src/commit/43142e4470df976a459a1a2e95cfb163afc42893/keystone/identity/core.py#L935
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/src/commit/43142e4470df976a459a1a2e95cfb163afc42893/keystone/federation/core.py#L73-L77

Change-Id: I7c068e350811e22622d1f1e7d8b0a55d4d7cab11

commit_message:
Drop project.id foreign keys

In 2bd88d30 we added a new column domain_id to the user table to
deduplicate the domain_id columns in the local_user and nonlocal_user
tables, and at that point made the user.domain_id column a foreign key
referencing the project.id column. This is a problem that led to
3d46c8a5 in which we removed the ability for the resource driver to be
pluggable, since we had linked two sql backends together and made them
reliant on one another.

This commit removes the foreign key constraint from the user table and
the identity_provider table. For the user table, the sqlalchemy model
never reflected this schema so we don't need to change the model. For
the identity_provider table, we need to update the model. In both cases,
we already enforce, at the manager layer, the constraint that the
domain_id needs to reference a real domain ID[1][2], so we do not need
to rely on this constraint at the database layer.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/src/commit/43142e4470df976a459a1a2e95cfb163afc42893/keystone/identity/core.py#L935
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/src/commit/43142e4470df976a459a1a2e95cfb163afc42893/keystone/federation/core.py#L73-L77

Partial-bug: #1672713

Change-Id: I7c068e350811e22622d1f1e7d8b0a55d4d7cab11

[{'created': '2019-10-31 14:21:23.000000000', 'message': 'Increase timeout when waiting for dnsmasq enablement

In the reported bug, a regression was introduced in [1] when limiting
the time to have a "dnsmasq" process enabled. It has been reported, as
documented in the bug, that in older versions (Queens), using Python 2
[2] and older versions of "ip_lib" (not implementing most of the
commands using Pyroute2), that the time needed to spawn a "dnsmasq"
process exceeds the default 60 seconds defined in
"common_utils.wait_until_true".

This patch increases this time by a reasonable 300 seconds.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/643732
[2] https://bugs.python.org/issue35757

Change-Id: I2d8693145da72825876b951f2d10afe9ca28ff6e
Closes-Bug: #1849676
(cherry picked from commit aedc09917680bc77501f4b57142e73768e3d06ad)
'}]
commit_message:
Increase timeout when waiting for dnsmasq enablement

In the reported bug, a regression was introduced in [1] when limiting
the time to have a "dnsmasq" process enabled. It has been reported, as
documented in the bug, that in older versions (Queens), using Python 2
[2] and older versions of "ip_lib" (not implementing most of the
commands using Pyroute2), that the time needed to spawn a "dnsmasq"
process exceeds the default 60 seconds defined in
"common_utils.wait_until_true".

This patch increases this time by a reasonable 300 seconds.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/643732
[2] https://bugs.python.org/issue35757

Change-Id: I2d8693145da72825876b951f2d10afe9ca28ff6e
Closes-Bug: #1849676
(cherry picked from commit aedc09917680bc77501f4b57142e73768e3d06ad)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-23 13:14:28.000000000', 'message': 'Improve the error message for bad pkcs12 bundles

When a user loads a bad pkcs12 bundle or one with a pass phrase into
barbican and then uses it for a TLS-TERMINATED listener, the error
we return the user is misleading[1].
This patch improves the error message to point out that we got the
bundle from barbican, but that it is unreadable and/or protected
with a pass phrase.

[1] Could not retrieve certificate: [ ... ] (HTTP 400)

Change-Id: I6ad0349dba62b1141be07bfb0e40171e9f7a91b9
Story: 2006587
Task: 36713

commit_message:
Improve the error message for bad pkcs12 bundles

When a user loads a bad pkcs12 bundle or one with a pass phrase into
barbican and then uses it for a TLS-TERMINATED listener, the error
we return the user is misleading[1].
This patch improves the error message to point out that we got the
bundle from barbican, but that it is unreadable and/or protected
with a pass phrase.

[1] Could not retrieve certificate: [ ... ] (HTTP 400)

Change-Id: I6ad0349dba62b1141be07bfb0e40171e9f7a91b9
Story: 2006587
Task: 36713
(cherry picked from commit a0f4335c38cdf5d5c91877975b8f3c7b28e169eb)

commit_message:
Fix enabled_services to include all_nodes_extra_map_data

When the tripleo-hieradata role was imported[1] from tripleo-common[2],
the handling to create all_enabled_services from enabled_services and
all_nodes_extra_map_data was lost.

This caused several data items to be missing in the multi-stack case.

This patch restores the original functionality.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673364/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673366/

Change-Id: Ia58fd299942954c39214bad76cbcf40ad4371f18

commit_message:
Add a more clear error message when we fail to backup cib

Currently people get 'unable to get cib' error messages and assume
that the cluster is in a bad state. This error can be returned
in mainly two cases:
A) When the cluster is down or has issues and pcs is unable to get the CIB
B) pcs is being run from within a container and the pcmk version in the
   container is not compatible with the pcmk version running on the
   host.

Change-Id: I1c74f11b2c0d5e925a3a04de2ecb35c354496c4c

Updates for dcn/dcn-hci sample envs

Adds a mapping for OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::OVNDBsVipPort to
OS::Heat::None for dcn stacks, and adds the ManageNetworks parameter to
sample environments.

[{'created': '2019-11-06 19:29:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add ManageNetworks parameter

The ManageNetworks parameter has been added. The parameter controls
management of the network and related resources (subnets and segments) with
either create, update, or delete operations (depending on the stack
operation).  Does not apply to ports which will always be managed as
needed. Defaults to true.

For multi-stack use cases where the network
related resources have already been managed by a separate stack, this
parameter can be set to false.

Change-Id: I5ea71eea77b9f5868ddcd468bf2d3c4ab78d7c02

management of the network and related resources (subnets and segments) with
either create, update, or delete operations (depending on the stack
operation).  Does not apply to ports which will always be managed as
needed. Defaults to true.

For multi-stack use cases where the network

Change-Id: I5ea71eea77b9f5868ddcd468bf2d3c4ab78d7c02

commit_message:
Add ManageNetworks parameter

The ManageNetworks parameter has been added. The parameter controls
management of the network and related resources (subnets and segments) with
either create, update, or delete operations (depending on the stack
operation).  Does not apply to ports which will always be managed as
needed. Defaults to true.

For multi-stack use cases where the network
related resources have already been managed by a separate stack, this
parameter can be set to false.

Change-Id: I5ea71eea77b9f5868ddcd468bf2d3c4ab78d7c02

commit_message:
Include ceph-ansible filter_plugins

As of version 4, ceph-ansible ships it's own filter_plugins [1]
so we need to include them in the environment when tripleo
executes ceph-ansible.

Closes-Bug: #1852136

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/commit/5fea830414e7eb4cf6f1d0008834e2c4b205b131

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-12 12:28:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ssh_known_hosts hostname entries

Previously the tripleo-ssh-known-hosts ansible role used the list of
network names to create the different possible hostnames in the
ssh_known_hosts file. The network names do not match the actual network
hostnames, like internal_api vs. internalapi which results in ssh host
verification to fail and e.g. live migration to fail.

This changes to use the _hostname inventory information to be used to add
hostname information to the ssh_known_hosts file.

Change-Id: If6e99c65084db35a2a4aa1e76b0b89fb5902794a
Closes-Bug: #1852064
(cherry picked from commit a5bcbc8d015b792b3546ecbb139506f248dacfe8)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ssh_known_hosts hostname entries

Previously the tripleo-ssh-known-hosts ansible role used the list of
network names to create the different possible hostnames in the
ssh_known_hosts file. The network names do not match the actual network
hostnames, like internal_api vs. internalapi which results in ssh host
verification to fail and e.g. live migration to fail.

This changes to use the _hostname inventory information to be used to add
hostname information to the ssh_known_hosts file.

Change-Id: If6e99c65084db35a2a4aa1e76b0b89fb5902794a
Closes-Bug: #1852064
(cherry picked from commit a5bcbc8d015b792b3546ecbb139506f248dacfe8)

commit_message:
Fix ssh_known_hosts hostname entries

Previously the tripleo-ssh-known-hosts ansible role used the list of
network names to create the different possible hostnames in the
ssh_known_hosts file. The network names do not match the actual network
hostnames, like internal_api vs. internalapi which results in ssh host
verification to fail and e.g. live migration to fail.

This changes to use the _hostname inventory information to be used to add
hostname information to the ssh_known_hosts file.

Change-Id: If6e99c65084db35a2a4aa1e76b0b89fb5902794a
Closes-Bug: #1852064

[{'created': '2019-10-04 14:41:20.000000000', 'message': "tempest cleanup - use admin_mgr only

Avoid using temporary managers and use only the admin one. The tool
has been using the admin_mgr for listing projects, roles, for listing
all resources during initializing a saved state so why don't use it also
for deleting all of the resources?
This wil solve the Unauthorized issue happening when the tool
was requesting credentials for the project from a different
domain.

Closes-bug: #1766582

Change-Id: Ibb5599ce48712b94dbf591e4a30cf3906cb5cdde
"}]
commit_message:
tempest cleanup - use admin_mgr only

Avoid using temporary managers and use only the admin one. The tool
has been using the admin_mgr for listing projects, roles, for listing
all resources during initializing a saved state so why don't use it also
for deleting all of the resources?
This wil solve the Unauthorized issue happening when the tool
was requesting credentials for the project from a different
domain.

Closes-bug: #1766582

Change-Id: Ibb5599ce48712b94dbf591e4a30cf3906cb5cdde

[{'created': '2019-11-05 15:51:51.000000000', 'message': 'Standardize on nginx-extras

The use of nginx-full causes a service restart on package update
which brings down the keystone endpoints.

Change-Id: Ic9cc341edb6f2f0ba76bd301c9782fbcc5951544
Related-Bug: 1847395
'}]
commit_message:
Standardize on nginx-extras

The use of nginx-full causes a service restart on package update
which brings down the keystone endpoints.

Change-Id: Ic9cc341edb6f2f0ba76bd301c9782fbcc5951544
Related-Bug: 1847395

commit_message:
recon: Stop logging tracebacks for well-known failures

They mostly just add noise to the log; log a desciption of the error,
but that should be plenty.

While we're at it, drop translations and bring missing-recon-file
problems down to just warnings.

Change-Id: I80c3eb536a7e0fc415c05027cf2a977915f2e325
Closes-Bug: #1646410

commit_message:
Install agnostic libpython3-dev package instead of libpython3.5

As default python in bionic is 3.6, shared library for this version is
not installed, that, at least, breakes uwsgi.
Unfortunatelly there's no non-dev meta package for libpython3, so picked
the best fit: libpython3-dev.

Change-Id: I43f1f1b1918ea47d2083d1e9c737b787271de318

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ifef966a1dcddf1b77209e3ce3adff7158c53f71e

[{'created': '2019-10-07 14:15:53.000000000', 'message': 'Merge component, developer and multinode ingress deployment scripts

For simplification of deployment and maintenance, reduce the number
of scripts that do usually the same.
The important part is that when user wants to do multinode deployment,
OSH_DEPLOY_MULTINODE variable must be set before executing the script.

For now multinone script still stays, only to invoke the common one,
but in future it would be better to remove multinode scripts completely
and let user call the common script with the right argument.

Change-Id: I4dca159827581cbe8d6ded3be85e732acbf60ed1
'}]
commit_message:
Merge component, developer and multinode ingress deployment scripts

For simplification of deployment and maintenance, reduce the number
of scripts that do usually the same.
The important part is that when user wants to do multinode deployment,
OSH_DEPLOY_MULTINODE variable must be set before executing the script.

For now multinone script still stays, only to invoke the common one,
but in future it would be better to remove multinode scripts completely
and let user call the common script with the right argument.

Change-Id: I4dca159827581cbe8d6ded3be85e732acbf60ed1

commit_message:
Switch to opensuse-15 nodeset

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use
it by default going forward.

The new job tempest-full-py3-opensuse15 use the opensuse-15 nodeset,
change tempest-full-py3-opensuse150 to tempest-full-py3-opensuse15.

Change-Id: Ia76b107a137a39716253631e5a8d294f7ee9614e

commit_message:
Switch to the opensuse-15 nodeset

We are trying to deprecate the opensuse-150 label type in favor of the
opensuse-15 label. The reason for this is opensuse 15, like centos,
doesn't support its older point releases and instead expects users to
keep up to date on its minor updates. This allows us to carry one fewer
image in opendev and ensures we are testing supported releases.

Change-Id: Ia215dba2b2495b79b762525e59bac527fba7a8bc

commit_message:
Switch to the opensuse-15 nodeset

We are trying to deprecate the opensuse-150 label type in favor of the
opensuse-15 label. The reason for this is opensuse 15, like centos,
doesn't support its older point releases and instead expects users to
keep up to date on its minor updates. This allows us to carry one fewer
image in opendev and ensures we are testing supported releases.

Change-Id: I6c628ed9710d06f51d8123167fc0b08155dd7750

commit_message:
Convert legacy functional jobs to zuulv3

This commit merges the legacy functional test jobs (core and adv-svcs)
into neutronclient-functional. FWaaS v1 was dropped in Stein and
adv-svcs job now checks only VPNaaS, so it looks too much to have
a separate job for VPNaaS.

Note that tls-proxy is disabled as the base class for functional tests
(neutronclient.tests.functional.base.ClientTestBase) does not support
HTTPS endpoints. This can be tackled separately.

Change-Id: I714efd1bc14cbba85f7b4caf6834ce375ff89547
(cherry picked from commit 6330cc1980958f57cb95684c8d7a1aaa89a7fbf6)

commit_message:
Minimal fix for spawning periodic notification process

The current comparision between an int and a dict always returns
false so the periodic notification process never spawns. This minimal
fix should get it working again. A later patch could support user
defined periods.

Story: 2006783
Task: 37313
Change-Id: If0649a1fe6a5337a20f0aba9a1a4ea8a0dd04617

[{'created': '2019-11-11 15:04:48.000000000', 'message': 'Do not try to read raw disk data as unicode

Fixes regression in commit 9f8fa2853af00045118ccd44180e7053e6d027af:
utils.execute returns unicode by default, but this data is binary.

Change-Id: I5b54c1f6cfac5fff672245c523b9fb647478edbd

commit_message:
Do not try to read raw disk data as unicode

Fixes regression in commit 9f8fa2853af00045118ccd44180e7053e6d027af:
utils.execute returns unicode by default, but this data is binary.

Change-Id: I5b54c1f6cfac5fff672245c523b9fb647478edbd

[{'created': '2018-07-23 12:20:29.000000000', 'message': 'WIP libvirt: Forcibly disconnect volumes during post_live_migration

WIP change showing an example of when we could use the force flag to
disconnect volumes from a host. In the case of post_live_migration we
are sure that any failures to disconnect a volume from the source can be
ignored as the instance is now running on the destination.

Change-Id: I00b7975eb5f4306ecf5b565e57ae8c5773fde1c0
'}]
commit_message:
WIP libvirt: Forcibly disconnect volumes during post_live_migration

WIP change showing an example of when we could use the force flag to
disconnect volumes from a host. In the case of post_live_migration we
are sure that any failures to disconnect a volume from the source can be
ignored as the instance is now running on the destination.

Change-Id: I00b7975eb5f4306ecf5b565e57ae8c5773fde1c0
